The good: this house I clean, conveniently located, pet friendly, and we felt safe. We loved the fenced yard. The house is older and has a lot of charm as a result. We were comfortable. This town is clearly old and trying to revitalize, and this house reflects efforts to maintain its charm while doing so.
The not so good: when we arrived, the WiFi was not working. We messaged at ~9:30 the night of check in that it was not working and did not get a response until 12:45pm the following day. Unfortunately, as we had digital work to do, this was very inconvenient. We searched for the router and did not initially find it. On our second day, we located it *unplugged* behind the bed. This should have been checked before we arrived. The WiFi is slow but acceptable when functioning. The shower drains VERY slow, so it’s a race between you and the drain not to risk flooding the bathroom.
We would stay here again, and I think it’s a good stay. It could use a little more attentiveness.

This is a very beautiful and spacious rental. The decor is beautiful. I have recommend a few things that would have made our review great instead of good.
1. Extra garbage bags for the kitchen and bathrooms are definitely needed when you rent for multiple days. We had to purchase some.
2. There are no mixing bowls. Its difficult when cooking meals and/or baking.
3. There was not a cupcake/muffin pan there but we bought one and left it there.
4. Additional bathroom toiletries may need to be requested for extended stays if you travel light.
5. Additional laundry pods may be needed for extended stays. One was provided.
6. The floor as you walk into the living room is kind of weak. If you are heavy, be safe.
This was our very first Air B&B stay. I am actually familiar with the area from working at the local hospital for almost 9 years. A few of my friends that are local stopped by to visit while we were there and were completely impressed with this rental. I assured them that they must refer it to their friends and family that will visit Kinston.
The neighbors are sweet. The yard is FANTASTIC. The park that is in walking distance is AMAZING.
I pray that this rental is available for our next extended visit. I can not wait to bring my nieces and nephews. The couch is amazing. It is so large and as comfy.
Thank you for providing this beautiful safe place to stay. We are now Air B&B hooked and can not wait to try others.
P.s. The Christmas lights all lit up upon our arrival made us smile so big. It was beautiful. Magical after a very long 11 hour drive.
Relaxing in front of the Christmas Tree on your comfy couch was the perfect way to start our stay.
Thank you so much for allowing us to make such amazing memories.

Great house and yard. Our family of 10 stayed here, with children ages 6-14 and had a great week. It was a quick drive to see all the Kinston sites. The house was super clean and it was the best product (shampoo/conditioner/soap) and towel amenities we have ever had at an AirBNB. Additionally, the coffee options in the kitchen, the pots/pans/utensils, the cleaning supplies were the best I have every seen at any AirBNB. We could really cook in house all week very easily and the layout of the kitchen made it party central. The only downsides were that a bunch of lights were out, bathroom fixtures were broken etc. (80% were fixed very promptly)
Things to consider if you are going to stay here:
1. There are a LOT of doors to the outside, including from the kids bunk room. While all had deadbolts, it did make us nervous that one of the kids would easily get outside and we would never hear them.
2. The lights were out in most of the porch lights, which made us feel a little uncomfortable because the area is a little run down (boarded up houses nearby etc). But we had ZERO issues the entire week.
3. The light in the dining room is so dim it's really challenging to play board games and do art projects that require the ability to read small details or done any "fine details" on crafts because it's just...dark. So the kids (and adults who are older!) struggled with that.
4. And if they weren't playing games/doing crafts, they wanted to stream movies. But the big tv in the main room that is pictured is not a smart tv and we could only get one station.
We had a wonderful and fun week there - the house was the perfect layout and size. We would definitely consider staying again if we came back to Kinston! It was a fun trip!
